document.heading: Kiowa Tribe Election Law of 2022
document.preamble: At a duly called session of the Legislature of the Kiowa Tribe held this 8th day of November 12, 2022, the following resolution and law were adopted.

recital.text: The citizens of the Kiowa Tribe voted to approve the new Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe ("Constitution") on April 17, 2017 through a Secretarial Election conducted by the BIA; and,

Prior to the final approval of the Kiowa Tribe's new Constitution by the BIA, the Kiowa Business Committee enacted the First Election Law of 2017 to govern the implementation of the New Constitution and the First Election; and,
The Kiowa Tribe Legislature is vested with the authority to pass laws and resolutions pursuant to Article IV, Section 6(a) of the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe; and,

Article IX, Section 3(a) of the Constitution states, there shall be an Election Commission vested with the responsibility to conduct legitimate elections in a fair and impartial manner in accordance with the Constitution and laws of the Tribe; and,
The Kiowa Legislature has identified that no election laws have been enacted to provide additional guidance to the Election Commission since the First Election laws had been adopted; and,
The purpose of this Kiowa Election Commission Ordinance is to establish procedures for the effective administration of the Kiowa Election Commission; and,
The Kiowa Legislature deemed it necessary and proper to create a new election law to establish procedures, rules and regulations to conduct the election process.

recital.conjunction: NOW THEREFORE IT BE IT RESOLVED;
recital.text: that the Legislature hereby enacts the attached law entitled, "KIOWA TRIBE ELECTION LAW OF 2022".
that this law shall supersede all laws, resolutions, policies, and ordinances that pertain to Kiowa Tribe Elections.

procedural-data.text: The foregoing resolution KL-CY-2022-020 was duly voted upon by the Legislature on November 12, 2022, at a Legislative Regular Session LXVII (67) with a vote of (5) in favor and (0) opposed, (0) abstain, and (2) absent pursuant to the authority vested in the Legislature by the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe.

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the "KIOWA TRIBE ELECTION LAW OF 2022".

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of the law is to provide guidance and procedures the Kiowa Election Commission to conduct legitimate elections in a fair and impartial manner. To clarify, outline and further delineate the authority, duties and responsibilities of the Kiowa Election Commission.

section.heading: Findings
section.text: The Legislature hereby finds and declares that:

para.text: The Legislature has identified that no additional election laws have been enacted since the Legislature enacted the First Amendment of the First Election Law of 2017.

It is essential for the Kiowa Tribe to have election rules and regulations consistent with the current Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe to provide guidance and direction to conduct fair and impartial elections.
The lack of established election procedures has diminished the confidence of the Kiowa voters in the current electoral process.

section.heading: Establishment of Kiowa Tribe Election Law of 2022

para.text: This law shall govern all elections and election related activities consistent with the Constitution.
This law shall be immediately effective upon its completion of the Open Legislative Process in accordance with the Constitution, Article VI, § 8 (a).
All regulations and procedures will be in accordance with the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe. When conflicts arise, the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe shall supersede.
All prior election ordinances, laws, amendments and/or regulations or procedures formerly utilized by the Kiowa Tribe and Kiowa Election Commission in the conducting of elections are hereby repealed.

section.heading: Amendment
section.text: Any subsequent amendments made to this law must be enacted by the Legislature in accordance with an open legislative process as required by the Kiowa Constitution. A statement shall be included in the purposed resolution identifying the specific provision which will be superseded, repealed, or amended.

section.heading: Severability
section.text: If any provision(s) of this law are declared invalid by the Judicial Branch, the invalid provision(s) shall be severed, and the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect.
